name: v2.0.0
body:
### What's New
- Migrated the Kitura framework to be a pure Swift 4 package.
- Improved developer experience by adding new Codable routing support for common HTTP verbs (i.e. GET, PUT, POST, PATCH, DELETE).

### What's New
- Add support for Swift 4
- Allow the limit on consecutive Keep-Alive requests per connection to be configurable.  The default has been changed to allow an unlimited number of requests.

name: Kitura 1.7
body:
We are delighted to release Kitura 1.7 with:
- Swift 3.1 support
- Swift 3.0.2 backwards compatibility
- Improved memory management
- Improved interrupt handling
- [MySQL plugin for Kuery(SQL abstraction layer)](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/SwiftKueryMySQL)
- [Hierarchical configuration manager for Swift applications](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Configuration)
- Unified query string parsing
- New JSON send APIs without SwiftyJSON dependencies
- Improved server cleanup
- SSL fixes
- The usual squashed bugs

name: Kitura 1.6
body:
We are delighted to release Kitura 1.6 with:
- Significant performance improvements in Kitura route matching
- Fixes for SSL related contention issues
- Faster, more comprehensive unit tests covering SSL
- HeliumLogger enhancement to print to TextOutputStream
- HTML boilerplate for Kitura-Markdown
- Fix for unexpected process exit on SIGPIPE
- Linux foundation memory leak workaround
- The usual squashed bugs

name: Kitura 1.5
body:
We are delighted to release Kitura 1.5.
- [Kitura-WebSockets](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-WebSocket)
- [Kitura-Chat-Server](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-Chat-Server)
- Improve test coverage
- Fix specification compliance for Accept\* headers
- Fixed memory Leak when checking headers
- Fix issues running tests under code coverage tooling
- Remove reference loop in Kitura-net
- Remove use of String.CompareOptions.regularExpression because of memory leak on linux
- Fix ClientResponse parsing issues

name: Kitura 1.4
body:
We are delighted to release Kitura 1.4
- Swift 3.0.2 support
- [PostgreSQL plugin for SQL abstraction layer](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Swift-Kuery-PostgreSQL)
- Rewrite cookie parsing implementation for specification compliance
- Enable custom UserProfile fields and their retrieval from identity providers
- Enhance features and performance of HeliumLogger
- Add a template engine for Markdown
- Fix some memory issues in Kitura Middleware
- Avoid URLComponents memory leak on Linux
- Added and fixed some unit tests
- Squashed a few bugs

name: Kitura 1.3
body:
We are delighted to release Kitura 1.3.

## Features
- Many improvements to [handling of percent encoding](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura/issues/857) in parameters
- New monitoring hooks in `Kitura-net` to enable HTTP performance monitoring
- New `URLComponents` property in `RouterRequest`
- Significant performance improvements to HeliumLogger
- Bugfixes

Enjoy!

name: Kitura 1.2
body:
We are delighted to release Kitura 1.2.

## Features
- Autocompletion and code assist now works properly with Xcode 8.1
- New `router.parameter()` methods for easier access to route parameters. See [the tests](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura/commit/529d37bcaf8917233dad22a6975f4a6cd7e47510#diff-62191f122beea5b2699e79c7da155cc7R129) for examples of use.
- CHTTPParser merged into Kitura-net to reduce git clones
- Support for `mergeParameters` to enable subrouters to access matched params defined in the parent router
- Bugfixes and performance improvements

Enjoy!

name: Kitura 1.1
body:
We are delighted to release Kitura 1.1.  Kitura 1.1 delivers support for Swift 3.0.1.

## Features
- Swift 3.0.1 support
- A lifecycle manager for Kitura so you can be notified when server startup is complete
- Bugs squashed

# Kitura 1.0

We are delighted to announce the release of Kitura 1.0.  Kitura is a high performance and simple to use web framework for building modern Swift applications. It scales out of the box, it is cloud-ready, and it's fun!

## Features
- Flexible routing
- Pluggable middlewares
- JSON parsing
- SSL/TLS
- FastCGI

## Swift Version

Kitura 1.0 runs on Swift 3.0, on both macOS and Ubuntu Linux.

Visit http://www.kitura.io to learn more.

### Features
- Migrate to Swift 3.0
- Deprecate Kitura-sys, remove the dependency from Kitura-net

### Enhancements
- Performance improvements
- Improved test coverage

### Documentation
- API documentation written for Kitura-Session, Kitura-Session-Redis, Kitura-Credentials, Kitura-Cache, HeliumLogger, Kitura-Compression, Kitura-CORS, Kitura-CSRF, Kitura-ResponseTime

### Swift Version

This release is designed to run on Swift 3.0!

### Features
- Migrate to the 09/07 Swift snapshot
- GRMustache supported on macOS

### Enhancements
- Performance improvements
- Memory leaks fixed
- More scalable on machines with more cores
- Other miscelaneous bugs fixed

### Documentation
- Wiki guide for working with templates (#685)
- Generation of API docs for Kitura and Kitura-net (#706)
  - view it at http://ibm-swift.github.io/Kitura/ and http://ibm-swift.github.io/Kitura-net/
  - we happily accept documentation pull requests!

### Swift Version

This release is designed to run on Swift **DEVELOPMENT-SNAPSHOT-2016-09-07-a**

name: v0.28.0
body:
### Features
- Migrate to the 08/23 Swift snapshot (#702)

### Enhancements
- Add `Kitura.start()` and `Kitura.stop()` (#696)
- `Connection: Close` header in ClientRequest is now optional ([Kitura-net#70](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-net/pull/70), thanks @dsperling)
- Ability to control `allowPartialMatch` on Router methods (#688, thanks @naithar)
- Miscellaneous bug fixes

### Documentation
- Improve doc for developing Kitura apps in Xcode (#552, thanks @saeki)
- Wiki guide for sessions with Kitura-Session (#647), and authentication with Kitura-Credentials (#649)
- Generation of API doc and initial skeleton content (#681)
  - view it at http://ibm-swift.github.io/Kitura/ and http://ibm-swift.github.io/Kitura-net/
  - we happily accept documentation pull requests!

### Swift Version

This release is designed to run on Swift **DEVELOPMENT-SNAPSHOT-2016-08-23-a**

name: v0.26.0
body:
### Features
- Migrate to the 07/25 Swift snapshot (#671)
- Implement Kitura-CSRF middleware (#653)

### Enhancements
- Add entry/exit functions for LoggerAPI (#646)
- Miscellaneous bug fixes

### Documentation
- Improved the directions for installing libDispatch (#659)
- Wiki guide for serving static files (#651)

### Swift Version

This release is designed to run on Swift **DEVELOPMENT-SNAPSHOT-2016-07-25-a**

name: v0.24.0
body:
### Features
- Enabled FastCGI Support in Kitura (#619, thanks to @simplepanda)
- HTTP Keepalive support (#435)

### Enhancements
- Minor performance improvements (#603)
- Generation of RouterHTTPVerbs (#613)
- Change use of CHttpParser to CHTTPParser (#629)
- Upgrade to most recent http_parser (#628)
- Improve the LoggerAPI (#523)
- Cleanup for API doc generation (#630)
- Miscellaneous bug fixes

### Documentation
- Code Conventions (#637)
- Wiki guides for Response Handlers and Parsing Requests (#639)

### Swift Version

This release is designed to run on Swift **DEVELOPMENT-SNAPSHOT-2016-06-20-a**

name: v0.22.0
body:
### Features
- Migrate to 06/20 Swift snapshot (#590)
- Implement CORS middleware (#585)
- Add JSONP support (#602)

### Enhancements
- Refactored codebase in order to improve quality and readability
- Fixed bug in body parsing and post requests
- Improved test coverage

### Swift Version

This release was configured and tested running on the June 20th development snapshot

name: v0.20.0
body:
### Features
- Migrated to the 05/31 snapshot
- Immediately migrated again to the 06/06 snapshot

### Enhancements
- Enhanced the multipart parser to accept unsupported headers (thanks to a PR from @dsperling)
- Fixed bug in using asynchronous code in handlers

### Swift Version

This release was configured and tested running on the June 6th development snapshot

name: v0.18.0
body:
### Features
- Added default error catching for route handlers
- Added a persistent store for session data using Redis. See [here](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-Session-Redis) for details
- Created middleware for compression:  https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-Compression
- Created middleware for recording response time: https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-ResponseTime

### Enhancements
- Redesigned APIs to conform with Swift 3 guidelines. See [here](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura/pull/490) for detailed changes
- Migrated to May 9th Swift snapshot 
- Small bug fixes and enhancements

### Swift Version

This release was configured and tested running on the May 9th development snapshot

name: v0.16.0
body:
### Features
- Added multipart form data parsing to BodyParser
- Added default OK return codes to handled requests
- Created plugin that authenticates using HTTP Basic and Digest authentication ([link](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-CredentialsHttp))

### Enhancements
- Simplified server startup API (See [README](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura#developing-kitura-applications) for details)
- Added APIs for "list" operations to [Kitura-redis](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-Redis)
- Various bug fixes and performance enhancements

### Swift Version

This release was configured and tested running on the May 3rd development snapshot

name: v0.14.0
body:
### Features
- Converted Redis module to be a pure Swift implementation
- Added link method to RouterResponse (thanks to a PR from @naithar)
- Implemented a new, simpler API for headers

### Enhancements
- Migrated to May 3rd development snapshot
- Changes to better conform to Swift 3 API guidelines
- Various bugs and memory leak fixes

### Swift Version

This release was configured and tested running on the May 3rd development snapshot

name: v0.12.0
body:
### Features
- Changed API to Swift 3 style
- Credentials now support web login for Facebook and Google
- Streamlined installation and setup of Kitura

### Enhancements
- Updated codebase to make it more Swift-like
- Migrated to April 25th development snapshot
- Various bugs and performance fixes

### Swift Version

This release was configured and tested running on the April 25th development snapshot

name: v0.10.0
body:
### Features
- Released credentials plugins for authentication using Facebook and Google logins
- Added accept method to RouterRequest for easy content negotiation

### Enhancements
- Expanded template engine support to allow use of multiple engines simultaneously
- Increased speed of running test cases

### Swift Version

This release was configured and tested running on the March 24th development snapshot

name: v0.8.0
body:
### Features
- Added the ability to specify sub-routers and mount them under a path.
- Added the route method to easily specify multiple HTTP methods under the same path.
- Added numerous convenience methods for modifying headers.

### Enhancements
- Updated entire codebase to run with the March 24th Swift snapshot.

### Swift Version

This release was configured and tested running on the March 24th development snapshot

name: v0.6.0
body:
### Features
- Added static file serving. Kitura can now serve static files such as JavaScript, CSS, and images.
- Added API support for cookies.
- Created an [adapter](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-StencilTemplateEngine) for the Stencil template engine.
- Created a [plugin](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-CredentialsGoogleToken) to [Kitura-Credentials](https://github.com/IBM-Swift/Kitura-Credentials) that uses Google OAuth.

### Enhancements
- Multiple handlers per route is now supported. In addition, an array of handlers can be provided for a given route.
- Improved documentation. We now have a developer wiki that covers topics such as developing a Kitura app in Xcode and testing.

### Swift Version

This release was configured and tested running on the March 1st development snapshot

name: v0.4.0
body:
### Features
- Added increased route configuration with path multiplicity (+,?,*)
- Added error handlers for routes
- Improved upon default landing page shown when the root route is not defined

### Enhancements
- Switched to official XCTest and Grand Central Dispatch frameworks
- Streamlined install process
- Added more documentation to public APIs
- Improved testing and continuous integration

### Swift Version

This release was configured and tested running on the March 1st development snapshot

name: v0.2.0
body:
Sample application that uses the Kitura framework:
- Basic URL routing (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) and middleware.
- URL parameters
- JSON parsing
